item.title: Stocks Fall as Investors Weigh Interest Rates, Ukraine War
item.description: Major stock indexes were down in afternoon trading, as investors tried to assess the possibility of a war in Europe.

item.title: Cisco Eyes an Expensive Fixer-Upper
item.description: It is a good time for the network giant to look for software deals, but Splunk may have some hidden costs.

item.title: Ukraine Changes the Playbook for the Market Selloff
item.description: Investors are starting to price in a potential war in Europe, though the market impact may be mostly limited to commodity-led inflation.

item.title: BlockFi to Pay Record Penalty to Settle SEC Probe of Crypto Lending Business
item.description: A cryptocurrency company that allowed nearly 600,000 users to earn interest by lending their holdings to other traders will pay $100 million to settle claims that its product violated investor-protection laws.

item.title: Bowl Might Not Have Been Super for Stocks
item.description: Orange is the new black when it comes to Super Bowl indicators.

item.title: How a Small Alabama Company Fueled Private Equity's Push Into Hospitals
item.description: A buying binge made Medical Properties Trust one of the biggest owners of U.S. hospitals. But its largest tenant piled up $800 million in losses.

item.title: Splunk, Blackstone, Nio, Affirm, Lockheed: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
item.description: Cisco made a takeover offer for Splunk; Lockheed Martin scrapped an acquisition plan.

item.title: Why Collecting Vintage Watches Took Off During the Pandemic
item.description: A watch’s provenance—who owned it, when and the story it tells—counts for more than it ever did.

item.title: Discover Is Bringing a Payment Option Popular in Asia to the U.S.
item.description: The card company is partnering with fintech firm Buy It Mobility Networks, whose technology allows consumers to pay directly from their checking accounts using merchants’ apps.

item.title: Indian Life Insurer Readies Country's Largest IPO
item.description: Life Insurance Corp. of India’s roughly $8 billion initial public offering would be by far the biggest listing ever undertaken in India.

item.title: Trial for Former Goldman Sachs Banker in 1MDB Case Set to Begin
item.description: Roger Ng’s trial is expected to offer a look at the measures Goldman employees took to reel in lucrative deals with 1Malaysia Development Berhad, a state-controlled economic development company.

item.title: The Stock Market Hasn't Looked This Cheap in Nearly Two Years
item.description: The year’s top-performing S&P 500 sectors are those that ended 2021 with the lowest price-to-earnings ratios.

item.title: How to Build American Science Back Better
item.description: Competing with China in emerging technologies is crucial, but both houses of Congress have come up with strange ways to do that.

item.title: Why Russian Invasion Peril Is Driving Oil Prices Near $100
item.description: Spare supplies of oil and gas are limited globally as demand rebounds faster than production, making a Russian move on Ukraine a serious geopolitical risk event.

item.title: How to Inflation-Proof Your Retirement Portfolio
item.description: There are pros and cons to almost every investment that claims to protect your nest egg from inflation.

item.title: Dry Weather in West Africa Pushes Up Cocoa Futures
item.description: The dry season in the Ivory Coast, by far the world’s largest exporter of cocoa beans, has been particularly dry in recent weeks, which has investors betting on a diminished crop and sustained price rises.

item.title: Saudi Arabia Moves $80 Billion in Aramco Shares to Wealth Fund
item.description: The stake transfer is part of a plan to boost the Public Investment Fund’s assets under management to over $1 trillion by 2025 and help diversify the kingdom’s oil-dependent economy.

item.title: Cathie Wood's ARK Stays the Course, Betting Big on Innovation
item.description: The flagship ARK Innovation exchange-traded fund has bought more than $400 million of high-growth stocks over the past two weeks.

item.title: SoftBank May Take Its Big British Tech Stock to Nasdaq. It Might Be Better to Stay Local.
item.description: Nasdaq is the go-to global market for tech. But that is exactly why London should be appealing, as local investors starved of growth stocks lavish it with attention it is unlikely to receive on the other side of the pond.

item.title: Why Artwork Flipping Can Incur the Wrath of Dealers
item.description: Dealers want to control the artists’ narrative and pricing. Investors want to leave it to the market.
